main event: A witness observed a pear-shaped object in the sky for about 15 minutes in Danville, Illinois on June 26, 1954.
interesting points: The observer used binoculars and a telescope to view the object., The object was described as silver-blue and transparent with no sound., The object was compared to a rawinsonde balloon in terms of its appearance and behavior., The sighting was reported by a source from the University of Illinois Airport., Multiple witnesses, including pilots from Ozark Airlines, reported seeing the object.
witness description: S/SGT HAYWARD observed through a telescope, with others including airline pilots also observing.
